key_points: Darren James and his family temporarily had $50 billion deposited into their Chase Bank account.
The error was discovered during a routine finance check.
James joked about the possibility of having a rich uncle but acknowledged it was just an unusual error.
Chase Bank corrected the account balance on Tuesday following the discovery.
James expressed concerns about whether his account was compromised due to the error.
Chase Bank admitted to the mistake, attributing it to a technical glitch impacting a limited number of accounts.
The bank corrected the issue one day after it occurred, according to Chase Bank spokeswoman Amy Bonitatibus.
Legally, people can be required to return funds mistakenly deposited into their accounts.
James stated he never considered spending the money due to his moral values.
James humorously mentioned if the situation was due to a promised inheritance from a Saudi Arabian prince, it might have been different.
